author: Africa Press Release
title: African Development Bank, World Food Programme (WFP) project boosts wheat production in war-torn Sudan amid soaring hunger
text:
An emergency wheat production project in Sudan financed by the African Development Bank ( www.AfDB.org ) and executed by the United Nations World Food Programme (WFP) has increased wheat production in the country by up to 70% in targeted project locations across five states within the past year.
The African Development Bank provided a total of $75 million to WFP for the implementation of the Sudan Emergency Wheat Production Project over the course of two years.
‚ÄúThis development comes at a critical time for Sudan, which is facing a looming hunger catastrophe due to the ongoing conflict, that has slowed down production in the past agricultural season,‚ÄùNnenna Nwabufo, the Bank‚Äôs Director General for Eastern Africa region said.
‚ÄúGiven the great potential that agriculture offers even under circumstances of active conflict, and with famine in Sudan on the horizon, threatening millions of lives, this project has brought a lot of hope.‚Äù
She added: ‚ÄúThis year alone, 22 percent of the national wheat demand was met through the project. Its impressive performance has demonstrated that there are viable solutions to increasing domestic production to address the rising levels of hunger and acute malnutrition in the country. We are pleased that the scaled-up delivery of certified climate resilient wheat seed varieties and fertilizers to smallholder farmers in the target areas across the country was timely, and saved a number of lives, under the prevailing challenges of conflict.‚Äù
Mary Monyau, the Bank‚Äôs Country Manager for Sudan explained the scope of the project. ‚ÄúThis wheat production project financed by the African Development Bank became the heart of production at this critical moment in Sudan. It provided food security, yielding 645,000 metric tonnes of wheat this year, and also became a critical crisis response intervention to the internally displaced persons,‚Äù she stated, adding, ‚ÄúMore than 30% of the beneficiaries in the Northern State are IDPs‚Äù.
She went on: ‚ÄúThe project was anchored on earlier game-changing wheat production initiatives under the Technologies for African Agricultural Transformation project implemented in 2018 to 2021, providing a clear example of how a longer-term development intervention can meet short-term emergency and humanitarian needs with forward-looking resilience building. We thank our development partner, the World Food Program, for implementing this project and ensuring positive outcomes in at least 5 states, namely Gezira, Kassala, River Nile, White Nile, and Northern States, despite the active conflict in the country.‚Äù
Summarising the scenario, WFP Sudan Representative and Country Director, Eddie Rowe, said: ‚ÄúThe ongoing conflict in Sudan has had a devastating impact on agriculture. Sudan produced merely half the wheat it would have produced in a typical year. Thanks to funding from the African Development Bank, WFP was able to mitigate some of the impacts of this war on wheat production.‚Äù
The project distributed climate-adapted wheat seeds and fertilizers to over 170,000 smallholder farmers in the five states during the 2023-2024 agricultural season, covering areas largely located in the relatively stable northern and eastern states of Sudan where conflict has not yet spread, as well as conflict-affected areas such as Gezira and White Nile states.
The yield of 645,000 metric tonnes of wheat this year accounted for 22 percent of the total wheat consumption needs of Sudan. On average, farmers reported a 44 percent increase in productivity per hectare as compared to the previous season. Around 16,000 of the farmers who received support had been newly displaced by conflict in the last 13 months. The project offered support and resources for these farmers to rebuild their livelihoods. In addition, 12 harvester machines were provided to farmers' associations in River Nile and Northern states to enable them harvest more efficiently to significantly reduce losses.
Sudan, which is facing an unprecedented hunger catastrophe, risks becoming the world‚Äôs largest hunger crisis. A new WFP analysis has identified 41 hunger hotspots, noting that about 2.1 million people are at high risk of falling into IPC 5 (Integrated Food Security Phase Classification) if they do not urgently receive humanitarian assistance.
Investments in agricultural productivity in Sudan are critical to increasing crop yields and food availability in the face of devastating levels of violence and hunger.
Distributed by APO Group on behalf of African Development Bank Group (AfDB).

author: @indiatoday
title: India sends 20 temporary offices for Myanmar ministries in post-quake support
text:
India sends 20 temporary offices for Myanmar ministries in post-quake support
India's humanitarian mission in earthquake-hit Myanmar, codenamed 'Operation Brahma', continues with the dispatch of further relief material.
In Short
- IAF airlifted 50 tonnes for prefabricated offices to Myanmar
- Two aircraft repatriated doctors of 60-Para Field Hospital
- India sent 750 tonnes of supplies, including essentials
Indian Air Force aircraft airlifted approximately 50 tonnes of components of 20 pre-fabricated offices to earthquake-hit Myanmar, as India's humanitarian mission 'Operation Brahma' continues. These structures are intended to serve as temporary offices for various ministries in Naypyidaw.
In a related development, two Air Force aircraft were also deployed to repatriate the doctors and personnel of the 60-Para Field Hospital following its de-induction.
The 200-bed field hospital, established as part of India‚Äôs immediate response to the recent earthquake, successfully provided medical treatment to 2,519 patients over the past two weeks.
Under 'Operation Brahma', India was the first to respond to the earthquake that struck Myanmar on March 28, which killed over 3,000 people.
To date, India has provided approximately 750 metric tonnes of relief supplies, including essential medicines, foodgrains, ready-to-eat meals, tents, blankets, generators, rapidly deployable surgical and medical shelters, water sanitation and hygiene services, drinking water, essential clothing, and the aforementioned 20 prefabricated office/residential structures.
Furthermore, India deployed an 80-member National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) Heavy Urban Search and Rescue Specialists Team and a 127-member Indian Army Field Hospital Team to assist in the aftermath of the disaster.
Prime Minister Narendra Modi spoke to Myanmar's military government chief, stressing India‚Äôs commitment to stand in solidarity with the people of Myanmar and to provide continued support during this challenging period.

author: Hallee Mandryk
title: Rally Around Homelessness laundry campaign officially kicks off | CTV News
text: Following the success of their 'I Gotch You' campaign, Rally Around Homelessness officially launched a new program called 'Fresh Start.'

author: @WSMV
title: Firefighters prevent explosion during TN house fire with 20 lbs. of gunpowder in garage
text:
Firefighters prevent explosion during TN house fire with 20 lbs. of gunpowder in garage
There are simple steps people should take to protect their weapons and explosives during a fire, officials said.
ROBERTSON COUNTY, Tenn. (WSMV) - Quick work by firefighters averted a highly dangerous situation in Robertson County when a home caught fire with explosives inside.
Pleasant View Volunteer Fire Department Lt. Drew Akin said they were called to the home along Stroudville Road on Wednesday evening that had multiple guns, ammunition and 20 lbs. of gunpowder inside.
Photos from our partners at Smokey Barn News showed flames shooting out of the attic of the home when firefighters first arrived on scene.
The owner told WSMV off camera he was asleep when the smoke alarms started going off. He grabbed their cats and ran outside to call 911.
PREVIOUS COVERAGE: TN home damaged in fire that left one injured
Akin said he sent a crew into the garage first because that‚Äôs where the gunpowder was being stored. They then worked towards the other areas of the house that were on fire to prevent an explosion.
‚ÄúThe structure will likely be a loss, but like I told the family, they‚Äôll be able to at least get inside and get some things out,‚Äù Akin said. ‚ÄúA lot of people don‚Äôt have that opportunity. I‚Äôm proud of the work that our team did.‚Äù
Here are instructions on how to watch WSMV4 live on various platforms.
Firefighters are used to dealing with guns and bullets going off in homes, but Akin said it is very important for people to have them stored properly. Explosives only further fuel a fire and pose a risk for crews in a house.
This family helped firefighters by having much of their weapons secured in safes and closing doors before they went outside. The door to the garage was covered with black smoke and char marks but was not burnt through.
‚ÄúDefinitely close the doors in your house,‚Äù Akin said. ‚ÄúI know it‚Äôs crazy. The house I live in, we try to keep the doors open to keep the air circulating. It can be tough especially when you are sleeping at night, but you‚Äôve got to close those doors. Closing the doors could potentially save your life and it can stop the spread of the fire and the smoke.‚Äù
Akin said people should also consider storing explosives somewhere outside of their main house, so they are insulated and have more time for firefighters to get to them.

topics: Disaster and Accident->explosion accident and incident

author: Alejandro Dur√°n
title: Air Canada se enfrenta a fuerte negociaci√≥n con sus pilotos que podr√≠a paralizar los vuelos | La Naci√≥n
text: La aerol√≠nea Air Canada mantiene en curso un proceso de negociaci√≥n con su sindicato de pilotos, el cual, de fracasar, podr√≠a llevar a la cancelaci√≥n de vuelos que afectar√≠a a 110.000 clientes de la compa√±√≠a en todo el mundo, a partir del pr√≥ximo domingo, seg√∫n confirm√≥ la empresa por medio de un comunicado. El pasado lunes, Air Canada inform√≥ de que se prepara para suspender la mayor parte de sus vuelos, en medio de negociaciones que se encuentran cerca del estancamiento con sus pilotos. La aerol√≠nea calific√≥ las exigencias del sindicato como ‚Äúreivindicaciones salariales excesivas‚Äù. Ahora, la compa√±√≠a solicit√≥ al Gobierno canadiense que ordene un arbitraje vinculante para evitar una interrupci√≥n significativa de los viajes a√©reos en caso de que las negociaciones fracasen. Hasta el momento, han transcurrido 100 d√≠as de reuniones entre la empresa y la Asociaci√≥n de Pilotos de L√≠neas A√©reas (ALPA, por sus siglas en ingl√©s), que representa a 5.200 pilotos de Air Canada. Seg√∫n la aerol√≠nea, ha ofrecido aumentos salariales sin precedentes, pero el sindicato los ha rechazado, exigiendo p√∫blicamente los niveles salariales vigentes en Estados Unidos, lo que ha bloqueado las negociaciones. Seg√∫n report√≥ el medio Toronto Star, en un gr√°fico proporcionado por el sindicato se logran apreciar diferencias salariales importantes a trav√©s de la frontera de ambos pa√≠ses, con pilotos estadounidenses que llegan a ganar m√°s del doble que sus hom√≥logos de Air Canada en algunas categor√≠as. Incluso donde la brecha es menor, existen amplias diferencias, dice el informe: para los capitanes con 12 a√±os de experiencia volando Boeing 777, los pilotos de United, Delta y American Airlines ganan un 76% m√°s en salario que hom√≥logos de Air Canada. LEA M√ÅS: Llegada de turistas de Estados Unidos y Canad√° compensa ca√≠das en mercados de Europa y Suram√©rica La Naci√≥n consult√≥ a Air Canada si la posible afectaci√≥n de sus vuelos impactar√≠a las operaciones en Costa Rica. El pasado martes, la aerol√≠nea respondi√≥ que, hasta el momento, estaban preparando planes de contingencia, pero que no contaban con m√°s detalles para compartir. De acuerdo con datos del Instituto Costarricense de Turismo (ICT), hasta agosto de 2024, Costa Rica recibi√≥ por v√≠a a√©rea 184.749 turistas canadienses, quienes en su mayor√≠a visitan el pa√≠s entre noviembre y abril. Seg√∫n informaci√≥n del Itinerario de Vuelos del ICT, para este 2024, Air Canda ofreci√≥ vuelos directos desde Montreal y Toronto, con llegadas al aeropuerto Daniel Oduber y al Juan Santamar√≠a. Sin embargo, la din√°mica es distinta seg√∫n la temporada de turismo. Por ejemplo, entre enero y marzo, meses de temporada alta, la ruta entre Montreal y Liberia tiene una frecuencia de cuatro vuelos semanales, mientras que la conexi√≥n con el Santamar√≠a era de tres veces por semana. Los viajes entre Toronto y Costa Rica (tanto a Liberia como a San Jos√©) eran diarios. Para setiembre, la aerol√≠nea disminuy√≥ considerablemente sus vuelos hacia Costa Rica, de acuerdo con el documento del ICT. Este mes solamente ofrece tres viajes directos entre Toronto y San Jos√©, los d√≠as martes, jueves y s√°bado. Tras una consulta de La Naci√≥n, el ICT inform√≥ de que hizo un seguimiento con la aerol√≠nea y los dos aeropuertos internacionales de Costa Rica, y que hasta el momento no se reporta afectaci√≥n para el pa√≠s, dado que los vuelos se mantienen seg√∫n la programaci√≥n original. Sin embargo, la instituci√≥n indic√≥ que, si llegara a producirse una suspensi√≥n o afectaci√≥n, tomar√° ‚Äúmedidas para mitigar cualquier impacto negativo y mantener el flujo de visitantes canadienses‚Äù. LEA M√ÅS: Air Canada planifica suspensi√≥n de vuelos por conflicto con pilotos Air Canada afirm√≥ que comenzar√≠a a aplicar la suspensi√≥n de vuelos una vez se emita un aviso de huelga o cierre patronal de 72 horas, el cual puede ocurrir en cualquier momento a partir del domingo 15 de setiembre. En un comunicado emitido este jueves, Michael Rousseau, presidente y director ejecutivo de Air Canada, se√±al√≥ que las negociaciones est√°n cerca de estancarse y el tiempo se agota, lo que pone en riesgo los planes de cientos de miles de clientes. ‚ÄúEstamos tomando todas las medidas para mitigar cualquier impacto, pero la realidad es que incluso una breve interrupci√≥n del trabajo en Air Canada podr√≠a, dada la complejidad de nuestro negocio a escala mundial, causar una interrupci√≥n prolongada para los clientes‚Äù, afirm√≥. La compa√±√≠a explic√≥ que las partes han mantenido reuniones durante 100 d√≠as en los √∫ltimos 15 meses, tiempo en el que se han negociado 1.110 temas. Durante este periodo, las partes acordaron provisionalmente modificar m√°s del 70% de los art√≠culos para mejorar y modernizar su convenio colectivo. Entre ellos, se incluyen un aumento salarial del 30% para los pilotos, mejoras en los planes de pensiones y en la atenci√≥n m√©dica. Adem√°s de Air Canada, tres aerol√≠neas m√°s vuelan de manera directa desde Canad√° a Costa Rica: WestJet, Sunwing y Air Transat, conectando con las ciudades de Calgary, Toronto y Montreal.

author: Alexis P√©rez Cerino" data-date-published="28/12/2023
title: Hay trabajo en Canad√° para carpinteros con salario de 45 d√≥lares por hora
text:
El 2023 llega a su fin, pero las oportunidades de empleo siguen apareciendo sin importar si estas se encuentran disponibles en M√©xico o en pa√≠ses como Canad√° , donde una empresa ofrece hasta 45 d√≥lares por hora en alguna de sus 10 vacantes para carpintero en la provincia de Ontario.
Se trata de un trabajo en el que se solicita el idioma ingl√©s, certificado de estudios, experiencia m√≠nima de 5 a√±os como carpintero, as√≠ como documentos que respalden entrenamientos para trabajos en alturas, curso de formaci√≥n sobre protecci√≥n contra ca√≠das, entre otros.
Los interesados deben estar dispuestos a viajar y contar con licencia de conducir v√°lida, as√≠ como otros documentos que permitan su libre tr√°nsito por el pa√≠s. En Fuerza Informativa Azteca puedes consultar en qu√© consiste el trabajo, c√≥mo aplicar y los beneficios que ofrecen por trabajar en Canad√° .
¬øEn qu√© consiste el trabajo para carpinteros en Canad√°? Las labores principales de un carpintero en Canad√° pueden variar debido a que la empresa puede asignar al trabajador a un sitio en el que requiere un especialista en carpinter√≠a industrial, comercial o de construcci√≥n.
Sin embargo, a grandes rasgos, estas son algunas de las responsabilidades y labores que tendr√°n que cumplir los interesados en trabajar en Canad√° :
Leer e interpretar planos, dibujos y bocetos para determinar especificaciones y calcular requisitos. Medir, cortar, dar forma, ensamblar y unir materiales de madera, sustitutos de la madera, acero liviano y otros materiales. Construir cimientos, instalar vigas de piso, colocar contrapisos y levantar paredes y sistemas de techo. En todos los casos, explica la compa√±√≠a en busca de carpinteros, los empleados deber√°n adaptarse a trabajar en las alturas, espacios confinados, ruidosos, con polvo o al aire libre, seg√∫n se requiera para los proyectos encomendados en alguna de las 10 ofertas laborales disponibles.
¬øQu√© prestaciones ofrece la empresa en Canad√°? La vacante ofrecida por la empresa canadiense lleva consigo varios beneficios, principalmente en √°reas de la salud como se describen a continuaci√≥n:
Beneficios de la salud Plan dental plan de atenci√≥n m√©dica Beneficios para el cuidado de la vista Beneficios a largo plazo Beneficios del seguro grupal Otros beneficios Aparcamiento disponible ¬øC√≥mo postularse al empleo para carpinteros en Canad√°? En caso de conocer a alg√∫n carpintero con experiencia que busque trabajar en Canad√° es importante saber que existen dos formas para aplicar a una de las 10 vacantes. La primera de ellas es ingresando directamente en la bolsa de trabajo del gobierno, la cual puede ser consultada aqu√≠ .
Mientras que, la segunda, es por correo electr√≥nico a la direcci√≥n: rima@haltonrebar.com para iniciar contacto directo con un empleador de la compa√±√≠a. Es importante recordar que, en todos los casos, los tr√°mites son gratuitos seg√∫n la descripci√≥n del gobierno de Canad√° .
Empleo ¬°No te pierdas nuestro contenido, sigue a Fuerza Informativa Azteca en Google News! Publicado: 28/12/2023 | üïë 21:27 Notas Finanzas Escrito por: Alexis P√©rez Cerino Compartir Tweet CopyLink Copiar enlace WhatsApp Facebook
